## Biography

Ryan Leitch represents businesses and business owners including those in manufacturing, retail, distribution, software and technology, construction, sales, and other service industries in numerous business matters.

The variety of business matters includes entity selection and organization, employment, mergers and acquisitions, and other transactions, loan transactions, general contractual matters, disputes among shareholders/members, and in business succession planning to assist owners in transferring/selling their business ownership to family members or employees.

Ryan represents individuals in estate and succession planning, including preparation of Wills, Trusts, Power of Attorney and health care designations, and other legal matters, and probate and administration of Wills and Trusts. He also has experience in representing lenders in large, complex creditors’ rights cases.

Ryan served as the Firm’s Managing Partner from 2002 through 2010, and on the Firm’s management committee from 2011 through 2012.

## Representative Matters

- Represented numerous business owners in the organization, formation, funding, sale, purchase or merger of their businesses, and in the preparation of various types of business contracts and agreements.
- Prepared numerous estate and business succession plans to assist clients in achieving their objectives, whether it be to pass their businesses on to their children or otherwise.
- Assisted numerous clients in the administration of trusts and the estate probate process.
- Assisted numerous clients with preparation of their wills and trusts, to accomplish their estate planning goals.
- Represented construction contractors in negotiating contracts, handling lien claims, and resolving other construction-related disputes.
- Served as lead counsel for a large hedge fund in a series of complex, multi-million-dollar business workouts and related business transactions.
- Recovered a total of approximately $100 million on behalf of a Fortune 500 client through the enforcement of a series of loan guarantees.
